column4: hey does anyone know how to get rid of "c compiler cannot create executables" error when doing ./configure on openvpn?
i already have that
./configure --with-ssl-lib=/usr/local/ssl/lib/ --with-ssl-headers=/usr/local/ssl/include/
open vpn
installing the headers isn't a workaround, it is just part of the normal installation sequence.
the headers are installed, it just couldnt find them, so i told it where it was (./configure is all you need if it is looking in the right place)
actually, ubuntu installs them in the wrong place, and the place configure was originally looking for them is correct.
not that it makes an difference
oh well that's interesting
it varies somewhat.  don't forget that there is a num lock key that changes some keys
there's usually a + and - both on the row of regular numbers and with the numpad that sprawls over the letters
yes, that's true.  But some of the non-english keyboards are missing certain keys (or rather the keys are used for other characters)
so on some foreign laptop keyboards you may need to use num lock to get +
weird
make that "weird and silly"
I agree.  I wasn't saying that it's a good idea, only that the behavior does exist.
last i checked, zsh didn't have tab-autocomplete
you can't be serious.  The tab completion features of zsh are one of the main reasons it is superior to bash

for example, with bash, if you complete and there are multiple completions, it types them and you have to type more of the name to disambiguate.  zsh does that, but if you then continue to press tab it iterates through the completions
zsh is what's on the school's server as the default login shell.  if i hit tab, nothing happens
then they have completion turned off.  You can easily re-enable it.  Create a .zshrc file in your home directory and set the flags needed for completion.
completion enabled is the default, so they must have disabled it in a config file in /etc
